ratings.comment: Sami was my favorite teacher I have had at Madison, and it is sad to see him leaving, but the fact that he got a teaching position at Harvard says something about him. He is dedicated to his students and makes sure everyone is understanding the lessons. His cultural days were fun and I won't forget failing hard at levantine Dabka dancing!

Sami is the most enthusiastic and dedicated TA you will ever have!!! He has high expectations (the only students who don't absolutely love him are those who are too lazy to learn Arabic). It is a hard language, but he makes it understandable and enjoyable. Seriously, he is phenomenal...wa aydan jameeeel!

Sami is a great teacher. He truly wants his students to learn and that matters for Arabic. I would take all my classes with Sami if I could and I'm sure I would enjoy just as much as I did 321. He is clear, he is reachable outside of class,and he is extremely nice and approachable. Best TA I've had at UW Madison.
Best instructor ever!!!! Halas that's it he is the best!!!
By far the best Arabic TA, maybe tied with his wife.  The Arabic department is not very organised but he does everything he can to make life easier.  Extremely fun class.
I wish I had a different teacher.
He is really a graet teacher. He knows what he is doing in his class. Lovely, sociable energetic person.

I think Sami is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He's very easy to talk to even outside of class, and although the class isn't easy (please-- it's Arabic) he is very helpful and genuinely wants people to do well. I'd definitely recommend him.

Sami's genuinely concerned with whether or not his students are learning. He'd gladly go out of his way to spend time on any concept, and sets aside his personal time outside of class for students to practice with him. It's no blowoff class, but you'll be well-prepared for all his tests if you do your work.
